items.title: Spot Prices Wrap: As Temps Plummet, Natural Gas Cash Cruises Higher
items.summary: Next-day spot gas prices rallied on Tuesday, supported by vast expanses of freezing air this week and forecasts for more to follow.

items.title: Futures Settle: Brutal Cold Galvanizes Natural Gas Price Bulls, Drives ‘Whopping’ Gain
items.summary: Frigid weather patterns bolstered heating demand and sent February natural gas futures flying early this week.

items.title: Billionaire Slim Deepens Mexico Oil, Natural Gas Push, Snaps Up Lukoil Assets
items.summary: Mexican billionaire Carlos Slim is expanding his energy empire as his conglomerate, Grupo Carso, moves to acquire 100% of Fieldwood Mexico LLC from Russia’s PJSC Lukoil.

items.title: MidDay Snapshot: Natural Gas Cash Prices Soar as Old Man Winter Tightens Grip
items.summary: With bitter cold threatening to shut in production and decimate inventories, natural gas spot prices rallied across the country amid resurgent supply and deliverability concerns.

items.title: Lower 48 Working Gas Surplus Seen Increasing Amid Weak Demand
items.summary: NGI is projecting the latest U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report through the week ended Jan. 16 to show a withdrawal of 95 Bcf.

items.title: Central Europe Cold Boosts Natural Gas Demand, Sustains Call on U.S. LNG
items.summary: The deepening cold over Central Europe has sparked speculative natural gas trading across the curve, pushing up global benchmarks and sustaining the pull of U.S. LNG across the Atlantic.

items.title: Global Natural Gas Prices Rally Amid Cold Blast, Renewed Trade Tensions
items.summary: Global natural gas prices climbed Tuesday as geopolitical tensions and frigid weather dominated headlines.

items.title: As Trump Targets Greenland, EU’s Dependence on U.S. LNG Comes Under Scrutiny
items.summary: As Europe weighs its approach to President Trump’s demand to buy Greenland, U.S. LNG imports are for now unlikely to be involved in any further trade tensions as the continent has become heavily reliant on the volumes to meet its energy needs.

items.title: Western Midstream Resets Delaware Basin Natural Gas Contracts in $610M Oxy Deal
items.summary: Western Midstream Partners LP (WES) is replacing legacy cost-of-service natural gas contracts for simpler fixed fees in the Delaware Basin with its biggest customer, Occidental Petroleum Corp., as it moves to operate more like a mature, standalone mi

items.title: MidDay Futures: Natural Gas Skyrockets as Forecasts Pile on HDDs
items.summary: Near-term forecasts trended massively colder over the Martin Luther King Jr. holiday weekend, sending natural gas shorts running for cover in Tuesday trading.

items.title: Oil Prices Slip as Traders Look Past Kazakhstan Disruption
items.summary: Oil prices fell in early Asian trading on Wednesday, with traders shifting focus away from what will likely be a short-lived supply disruption in Kazakhstan and back toward the prospect of rising U.S. inventories and renewed macro uncertainty tied to

items.title: India Deepens Energy Ties With the Gulf While Balancing Russian Oil Risk
items.summary: India’s energy strategy is increasingly defined by balance rather than allegiance. As demand surges and geopolitical pressure mounts, New Delhi is locking in long term supply wherever it can, from gas in the Gulf to discounted crude from Russia, alon

items.title: Venezuela Moves to Rewrite Oil Law as PDVSA’s Corruption Hangover Lingers
items.summary: Venezuela is moving to formalize oil-sector reforms that would expand partnership-style contracts and loosen PDVSA’s control over new investment, according to comments from the country’s top lawmaker on Tuesday. On Tuesday, National Assembly presiden

items.title: Kurdistan’s Oil Lifeline at Risk as Baghdad Payments Fall Short Again
items.summary: The Kurdistan Region of Iraq (KRI) is once again edging toward a fiscal breaking point. Officials in its Erbil-based semi-autonomous regional government (KRG) say they are receiving only a fraction of the budget transfers they are owed under the curr

items.title: Brent and WTI Climb as Tariff Threats and Kazakh Disruptions Rattle Markets
items.summary: Oil prices crept higher on Tuesday, with Brent and WTI both climbing as traders weighed a messy mix of geopolitics, supply disruptions, and macro tailwinds that all pointed in the same direction: higher risk, higher prices. Brent crude rose about 1.5
